urls.title: Environment Agency calls on construction industry to follow duty of care
urls.description: Mishandled rubbish from building sites can be hugely damaging to public health, communities and the environment

text: Environment Agency calls on construction industry to follow duty of care @EnvAgency - https://t.co/PoVoRXIoXS https://t.co/BFYBU0SVBH

1,168 complaints to the @EnvAgency in 6 days - the only reason they are now taking some form of action even though it‚Äôs not as stringent as it should be. Keep up the reporting - it‚Äôs forcing them to listen @BBCPanorama @StinkStopthe @itvnews #panorama https://t.co/wgy76rYwCx

text: @EnvAgencyMids Did your review on the 13th show any reason for the increased complaints and smell?  Rather worrying that we are 2 weeks from the 30th and the smell is getting worse.

Really hope the capping is done and works because the fumes have been getting worse and more frequent since the @EnvAgency issued their sanctions @StinkStopthe There also needs to be stringent EA management of the situation moving forward as we cannot afford to allow this again https://t.co/NpoSJDaeJ7

@Shropshire_Dad @jimallthetime Trout: indicate health of the wider river system. With @EnvAgencyMids nearby fish sampling station & our own surveys we'll monitor project impacts on & aim to help all fish populations. This year = ecological surveys to help ensure high quality environmental project outcomesüêüüòé

@CroxtethHall wetland looking good too. Starting to green over, although some of that is #HimalayanBalsam! We will be tackling that next month for #INNSWeek2021 with the help of @cpvolgroup to give the native plants we planted a chance to grow #AltCrossensCP @EnvAgencyNW https://t.co/9aDPwoWPrp
